summary: This cable discusses the Assassinations Records Review Board's (ARRB) request for assistance in approaching the FSB/SVR for the Lee Harvey Oswald file. The ARRB is seeking access to the KGB records on Oswald, which were originally held in Minsk but flown to Moscow in 1963 following the assassination, then returned to Minsk. The cable seeks station thoughts on the proposal to approach the FSB/SVR seeking access to the file and discusses implications of such a request.
title: RECORDS REVIEW BOARD AND DEPT OF STATE REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE IN APPROACHING FSB/SVR FOR OSWALD FILE
